description: Save your messy work for later or wipe it out.

slides.title: Why Stash? üì¶
slides.content:
# Context Switching

You are halfway through a feature, but you need to switch branches to fix a critical bug.

You can't switch/pull with dirty changes.

Option A: Commit half-broken code (Bad).
Option B: Stash it (Good).

slides.title: git stash
slides.content:
# Save for Later

`git stash`

Takes all your modified tracked files and staged changes, saves them on a stack, and reverts your working directory to the clean HEAD state.

slides.title: pop vs apply
slides.content:
# Retrieve ü§≤

- `git stash pop`: Applies the top stash and **removes** it from the stack.
- `git stash apply`: Applies the top stash but **keeps** it in the stack (useful if you want to apply it to multiple branches).

slides.title: Stashing Untracked Files
slides.content:
# New Files üìÑ

By default, stash only saves tracked (modified) files.

`git stash -u` (or `--include-untracked`) saves new files too.

slides.title: Listing Stashes
slides.content:
# The Stack üìö

`git stash list`

Shows all saved stashes.

`stash@{0}: WIP on main...`
`stash@{1}: WIP on feature...`

slides.title: Command Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which command restores the stashed changes AND deletes the stash from the list?

slides.title: Cleaning Up
slides.content:
# Trash üóëÔ∏è

Sometimes you just want to destroy untracked files (build artifacts, temp files).

`git clean`

WARNING: This is permanent. No trash bin.

slides.title: Safe Clean
slides.content:
# Dry Run üèúÔ∏è

Always check what will be deleted first!

`git clean -n` (Dry run). Shows you the list of files that WOULD be deleted.

slides.title: Force Clean
slides.content:
# Nuke it ‚ò¢Ô∏è

To actually delete files:

`git clean -f` (Force delete files)
`git clean -fd` (Force delete files AND directories)

slides.title: Undoing Local Changes
slides.content:
# Reset ‚Ü©Ô∏è

Discard changes to a file and revert to HEAD state.

`git checkout -- filename` (Old)
`git restore filename` (New, recommended)

slides.title: Unstaging
slides.content:
# Unbox üì§

You added a file to staging by mistake.

`git reset HEAD filename` (Old)
`git restore --staged filename` (New)

Moves file from Staging back to Working Directory.

slides.title: Safety Quiz
quizOptions: Shows a list of files that would be deleted (dry run)

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Stash & Clean üßπ

Tidy workspace.

- **Stash:** Save temporary work.
- **Pop:** Restore work.
- **Clean:** Delete untracked files.
- **Restore:** Undo changes.

## Next Steps
